title: Have USAA Home Insurance?  Live In Texas?

content: quote: Originally posted by OldArmyWOPA: quote: samh32 I like your avatar, this is my favorite 3rd ID logo. I spent three of my happiest army years, 69-71 as detachment commander/Chief Division Data Center in Kitzingen Germany. I would assume that the Marnmen were at Ft. Stewart and of course the sand box during your time. BTW, I spent four great years at Ft. Stewart, 72-76. Every morning during PT, we had to sing this song! I love the Marne Division, and during OIF 1, we showed the world how lethal a "DOGFACE SOLDIER" can be. I Wouldn't Give A Bean To Be A Fancy Pants Marine, I'd rather Be A Dogface Soldier Like I Am. I Wouldn't Trade My Old O.D.'s For All The Navy's Dungarees For I'm The Walking Pride Of Uncle Sam; On All The Posters That I Read It Says Be All That You Can So They're Tearing Me Down To Build Me Over Again I'm Just A Dogface Soldier With A Rifle On My Shoulder And I Eat Raw Meat For Breakfast Everyday. So Feed Me Ammunition, Keep Me In The Third Division, Your Dogfaced Soldiers A-Okay.
quote: Originally posted by OldArmyWOPA: quote: samh32 I like your avatar, this is my favorite 3rd ID logo. I spent three of my happiest army years, 69-71 as detachment commander/Chief Division Data Center in Kitzingen Germany. I would assume that the Marnmen were at Ft. Stewart and of course the sand box during your time. BTW, I spent four great years at Ft. Stewart, 72-76.
reply: Every morning during PT, we had to sing this song! I love the Marne Division, and during OIF 1, we showed the world how lethal a "DOGFACE SOLDIER" can be. I Wouldn't Give A Bean To Be A Fancy Pants Marine, I'd rather Be A Dogface Soldier Like I Am. I Wouldn't Trade My Old O.D.'s For All The Navy's Dungarees For I'm The Walking Pride Of Uncle Sam; On All The Posters That I Read It Says Be All That You Can So They're Tearing Me Down To Build Me Over Again I'm Just A Dogface Soldier With A Rifle On My Shoulder And I Eat Raw Meat For Breakfast Everyday. So Feed Me Ammunition, Keep Me In The Third Division, Your Dogfaced Soldiers A-Okay.
title: Have USAA Home Insurance?  Live In Texas?

content: Been with USAA since 1975, use their banking and loan department also. Renters Ins is good also,
reply: Been with USAA since 1975, use their banking and loan department also. Renters Ins is good also,
title: Have USAA Home Insurance?  Live In Texas?

content: You should be thankful that you can buy insurance. I have had State Farm Insurance for just over "30" years. They raised my rates from $245 per year in 1979 to $2,850 this past year. I bit the bullet and paid. Now they have dropped my policy plus all the other policy holders in Florida. In my search for a new insurance provider I went to USAA among others, they would not even talk to me because I live in Florida near the water. I have no idea on how to overcome this problem. My mortgage company requires that I have liability and windstorm. Windstorm alone, with a $6,000 deductible, costs me $2,500 per year above the libility. Yes, my present home insurance cost me $5,350 per year, $445 per month. I have not made a hurricane damage claim or any other type claim in the past 30 years. Again you should be thankful that you can buy insurance....

title: Have USAA Home Insurance?  Live In Texas?

content: Jack, you are added to a master policy the mortgagee maintains and adds it to your Mortgage Payment. Normally, this covers ONLY their interest and costs 5 or six times as much as your homeowners policy would. A bad deal all around, and YOU pay for your own "screw job". Don't let it happen.
reply: Jack, you are added to a master policy the mortgagee maintains and adds it to your Mortgage Payment. Normally, this covers ONLY their interest and costs 5 or six times as much as your homeowners policy would. A bad deal all around, and YOU pay for your own "screw job". Don't let it happen.
